summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Dallas Senior Affairs Commission (SAC) will convene on August 19, 2024, at 12:00 PM at Dallas City Hall, L1FN Auditorium, with an option for video conferencing. The meeting aims to address key issues affecting older adults in the community, including homelessness and senior programs in the upcoming city budget.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from the June 17, 2024, SAC meeting.
2. Chairâ€™s report on Texas Open Meetings Act requirements and updates on senior listening sessions.
3. Briefings on homelessness among older adults and an overview of senior programs in the proposed FY25 city budget.

**Important Details**:  
- Sarah Kahn from Housing Forward will present on homelessness among older adults.
- Jessica Galleshaw will discuss senior programs across multiple departments as part of the proposed budget.
- Updates on housing and neighborhood revitalization programs, including the Home Improvement and Preservation Program (HIPP) and Major Systems Repair Program (MSRP), will be provided by Jasmine Bazley and Kenesha Greer.
- Tabitha Taylor will report on Age-Friendly initiatives, and Mirka Norman will update on Senior Services programs and contracts.

**Action Items**:  
The Commission will seek approval of the meeting minutes and will discuss and potentially endorse the proposed senior programs and budget items. Public input will be invited, with speakers allowed two minutes each to share their perspectives.
